<!channel> ^^
Happy slacking!

Part of the reason we did this, is because the participants to the courses will be added to the Slack. The channel <#C2LNMQUMQ|basic-web-development> is dedicated to the HTML, CSS, JS course. The channel <#C2LNFBK0F|clojurescript> will be dedicated to the ClojureScript course that we start in November.

Hi all! As we talked about in an earlier call, I cleaned up the Slack :sweat_smile:. Please assign yourself to relevant channels! All old channels can still be viewed and searched here: <https://offcourse.slack.com/archives/archived>.

<!channel> We've got 8 great students for the Basic Web Dev barter bootcamp that's starting next week. Here's an overview of who's participating and what they're offering in return! >> <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v4QgXtPLSEMLiw9odVEclwAD0X4uiHTCUxocAOanBFA/edit#gid=0>

text: <!channel> I had an unexpected opportunity to meet with Ashley Williams (NPM) and Steve Klabnik (Mozilla) this afternoon, so I won't be able to join the call. I hope you all understand that I have prioritized this meeting. Since both of them are big figures in the open source community and very interested and actively involved in education, this will hopefully benefit our project and lead to new opportunities. Charlotte will moderate the call in my absence. I'll read the notes as soon as they are there.

files.title: Untitled
files.preview:
- Each column represents a week
- Each card represents an area that we're working on that has deadlines that week
- On every card, seperate actionables that have their deadline that week are listed in the checklist
- For every card, Accountables and Responsibles have been added as team members
- Colors represent areas that we're currently working in:

text: On the board:

To follow RJ's suggestion to make the planning a bit more interactive, I've tried using Trello for this 6 week 'sprint'. You've all received invites, or are already members. You can find the planning (board) here: <https://trello.com/b/PfbZrkSG>.
*Planning*
> <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1f7lJ9XvNqF6_uUpKiw5FySYzW6TNJJ2quB3to8bigCc/edit#>

<!channel> Guys 'n girls, I've made a spreadsheet where everybody can track their expenses. I don't know what we're going to do with the information yet, but this way, when money comes in, we at least know what everybody spent. I trust you guys, so you don't have to keep every receipt. If you've spent significant amounts in the past, you can backtrack those expenses and ballpark them.
